intro: Octarrhena gemmifera, commonly known as the gemmiferous acanthus, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and distinctive, palmate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Octarrhena gemmifera is known for its ability to form gemmae, which are vegetative propagules that allow it to spread effectively in its native habitat. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal environments.
